title: Credit union
summary: A credit union, a type of financial institution similar to a commercial bank, is a member-owned financial cooperative, controlled by its members and operated on a not-for-profit basis.  Credit unions generally provide services to members similar to retail banks, including deposit accounts, provision of credit, and other financial services.[1][2] In several African countries, credit unions are commonly referred to as SACCOs (Savings and Credit Co-Operative Societies).[3]
